articles.author: Suman Majumdar, Brendan Crabb, Emma Pakula, Stuart Turville
articles.title: The emergence of JN.1 is an evolutionary 'step change' in the COVID pandemic: Why this is significant - Phys.org
articles.description: Since it was detected in August 2023, the JN.1 variant of COVID has spread widely. It has become dominant in Australia and around the world, driving the biggest COVID wave seen in many jurisdictions for at least the past year.
